data.title: Our People & Values
data.meta_description: Discover the leadership team at Relativity. We seek leading talent with expertise in enterprise software from the world's leading technology companies.
data.text:
Phil Saunders

Chief Executive Officer

Phil joined Relativity as Chief Executive Officer in December 2022. He has more than three decades of operating experience in the technology industry. Phil has significant expertise in sectors germane to Relativity including enterprise SaaS, as CEO of both Cornerstone OnDemand and Saba Software; infrastructure technology, in roles at Oracle and Motorola; and cybersecurity, as an executive at SafeNet and Thales (formerly Gemalto). He is a dynamic leader with an intense focus on the needs of customers, partners, and the ultimate end user experience. Phil served on Cornerstone's public company Board of Directors while CEO and currently is a Board Director of Vertex, the Nasdaq-listed global leader in tax compliance software solutions. He received his bachelor’s degree from University at Albany, SUNY and his MBA from Seton Hall University.

Fun Facts

He is passionate about nutrition and fitness, and obsessed with oatmeal for breakfast.

He has three kids who have all followed in his footsteps and work in tech.

He loves to cook and makes a mean chili.

Chris Brown

Chief Product Officer

Chris Brown is the chief product officer at Relativity. He leads our product and user experience teams and is responsible for the development of Relativity’s product vision, strategy, and product roadmap in collaboration with engineering. Prior to joining Relativity, Chris held CEO and chief product officer roles for fellow Chicago-based companies Kapow Events and Orbitz Worldwide, respectively — where his teams delivered transformative online platforms for global B2C and B2B customers in the corporate events and travel industries. Chris began his career in Austin, Texas where he advanced to leadership positions in software engineering and product management, and earned his initial experience as an entrepreneur. An Illinois native and electrical and computer engineering graduate from the University of Illinois in 1998, Chris has served on the ECE Illinois Alumni Board since 2017.

Fun Facts

Loves coaching his four kids in soccer, basketball, volleyball, snowboarding, mountain biking, or anything else they will let him

Favorite mode of travel is by bicycle and hopes to bike across the country some day

Is an identical twin

Keith Carlson

Chief Technology Officer

Keith Carlson joined Relativity in 2019 as Chief Technology Officer. As head of technology and architecture strategy, Keith leads a global technical team of software developers and oversees all technology at Relativity, including the engineering delivery, engineering operations, and production engineering functions.

While at Relativity, Keith has simultaneously spearheaded advances in Relativity Server while driving architectural transformation to the cloud, applied his extensive technical experience to mature RelativityOne's SaaS delivery model, and launched cutting-edge product solutions such as Relativity aiR for Review and Relativity aiR for Privilege.

In his career, Keith has been a co-founder, programmer, team lead, principal engineer, and Chief Technology Officer. Prior to his time at Relativity, Keith spent over seven years at Amazon Web Services where he founded and led the inaugural cloud fraud prevention and detection organization. He has held previous positions at Bally Technologies, MCI WorldCom, and Charles Schwab. Keith received his bachelor's degree in Finance from Indiana University and his Magistri in Artibus Liberalibus Studiorum Prolatorum (Master of Liberal Arts) in Information Technology Management from Harvard University.

Fun Facts

First accessed the internet through his mother's work terminal at Indiana University in 1982

Grew up in southern Indiana and started playing basketball in his early teens and played multiple times per week into his early 40s

Has written production software in 17 different programming languages

Beth Clutterbuck

Chief Human Resources Officer

Beth joined the Relativity team in 2020 as CHRO and brings over 20+ years of human resources experience across four countries and five sectors (financial services, biotechnology, manufacturing, media text-left p-4 mt-0, and technology) to Relativity. In her former roles at Cloudreach and Deliveroo, Beth oversaw the building of the global people strategy and underpinning scaffolding to drive the rapid scaling of these high growth technology firms. In Beth's prior roles at NBCUniversal and HSBC, her main focus was on building cutting edge employee experience through talent programs and culture. Earlier roles at Citigroup and Honeywell provided Beth a strong foundational background as an HR business partner and talent leader. Beth and her husband Gavin have three children — Lucy, Lauren, and Charlie. Beth received her bachelor's and master's degrees from the University of Illinois Champaign-Urbana.

Fun Facts

Travelled (hiked, biked, and camped) every US state except Alaska

Has three children all born in Switzerland and has lived in four countries

Loves skiing and sailing – and is a bit of an adrenaline junkie

Steve Couling

Chief Sales Officer

Steve Couling joined Relativity's sales team in 2012 and was appointed Chief Sales Officer in 2024. He is a seasoned sales leader with nearly three decades of technology sales experience and 17 years working in the e-discovery sector, more than a decade of which has been dedicated to supporting Relativity's international growth. As CSO, he applies his robust industry expertise to further maximize value for customers, spearhead sales strategies, and lead Relativity’s global sales team. Steve has long been a driving force in Relativity's rapid expansion and evolution as a global market leader, starting as Director of International Sales before becoming the Vice President of International Sales in 2016, and Managing Director and Vice President Sales EMEA in 2019. He was the first ever Relativity employee hired outside of North America and played a key role in establishing and advancing Relativity's global footprint, building out teams and offices in the UK, Australia, Poland, Germany, Hong Kong, and Ireland. In 2023 Steve moved his family from London to Chicago to take on the role of Vice President of North American Sales. Prior to Relativity, Steve spent four years as an executive leader of LDM Global, an e-discovery service provider and early adopter of Relativity. He also held sales leadership roles at Toshiba and Kensington. Steve received his bachelor's degree from Nottingham Trent University and a diploma from the University of Sheffield.

Fun Facts

He is a self-confessed golf addict and currently plays off a 9 handicap.

He has completed 16 marathons, once completing four marathons in four days in China.

He's had afternoon tea at Buckingham Palace with the late Queen of England.

He's an avid football player (soccer for the US!) and lifelong Liverpool FC supporter – You'll Never Walk Alone.

Kirk Larsen

Chief Financial Officer

Kirk Larsen joined the Relativity team as Chief Financial Officer in April 2024. In his role, he is responsible for spearheading the financial management and strategic planning for Relativity, overseeing the organization’s finance and accounting functions. Kirk has more than three decades of financial leadership experience and an exceptional track record in scaling SaaS companies and building long-term value creation through strategic financial planning, capital allocation, and mergers and acquisitions. Most recently, Kirk was President and Chief Financial Officer of Black Knight Inc., a software, data and analytics company that serves the housing finance continuum. During his decade-long tenure, he played a pivotal role in several significant milestones including, its initial public offering, 11 acquisitions and its nearly $12 billion sale to Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. He has also held leadership positions in finance at ServiceLink and Fidelity National Information Services. Additionally, Larsen is a member of the Board of Directors of NCR Voyix Corporation. Kirk received his Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting at University of Wisconsin-Madison.

Fun Facts

He loves live music and recently went to three music festivals, in three states, in three days. His favorite recent concerts have been Foo Fighters and Ed Sheeran.

He enjoys traveling with his wife, especially to Italy and Napa, CA.

He enjoys playing golf and going to PGA Tour golf tournaments. Before he moved to Chicago to join Relativity, he lived in Ponte Vedra Beach, FL, home of the PGA Tour and The Players Championship golf tournament.

Cristina Rossman

Chief Marketing Officer

Cristina Rossman joined the Relativity team as Chief Marketing Officer in 2020. In her role, she is responsible for leading the marketing organization. With her extensive experience in building products, programs and functions from scratch, she brings an engineering mindset to decision making and execution while valuing the role of creativity in crafting differentiated experiences. Cristina has led teams through multiple stages of growth at both public and private companies. Most recently, she was Vice President, Product Marketing at Morningstar where she established a product marketing discipline within a newly centralized marketing function. In her 18 years at Morningstar working on both the product and marketing side, some of her notable accomplishments include launching and growing Morningstar Direct, a global investment analysis platform, as well as integrating marketing strategy for Morningstar’s largest revenue driving segment – asset management. She received her bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering from the University of Michigan and her MBA from University of California, Berkeley, Haas School of Business.

Fun Facts

Lifelong student of the French language

Plans her travel adventures around food and nature

Sneezes in direct sunlight thanks to Autosomal Dominant Compelling Helioopthalmic Outburst (ACHOO) Syndrome

Laurie Usewicz

Chief Partner Officer

Laurie joined Relativity as Chief Partner Officer in May 2023. Laurie has 25+ years in data security technology and partnership experience. As Chief Partner Officer, Laurie leads the team responsible for all go-to-market partner motions and works cross functionally with the executive team to drive alignment to deliver partner success. Most recently, Laurie was Senior Vice President, Business Operations & Strategy, SumTotal at Cornerstone OnDemand. She managed operations for the entire SumTotal business, which Cornerstone acquired from SkillSoft. She joined Cornerstone through the company’s acquisition of Saba Software and was the executive leader for the integration of Saba and Cornerstone. Following the integration, she ran sales strategy and business operations for the Americas for the combined company. Laurie has been recognized by CRN Magazine as one of the Top 100 Women in the Channel and recognized on the Channel Chief list for six consecutive years. She holds a Bachelor of Arts in marketing from St. John’s University.

Fun Facts

She has a husband and two children, Joey and Ashley. Her children are following closely in mom’s footsteps. Joey recently graduated college and has also ventured into software technology and Ashley is attending college in a four-year program to graduate with her master’s degree in marketing.

She never misses a day when it comes to her early morning workouts.

She enjoys boating on Lake Mahopac and will keep her boat out until the fall to enjoy the autumn colors on the trees.

Andrew Watts

Chief Customer Officer

As CCO, Andrew leads Relativity’s customer support, customer success and cloud operations teams. Andrew and his teams are responsible for developing the ultimate partnership and success for customers using Relativity’s products. Andrew has led the Service Delivery organization since 2018 and has worked with RelativityOne cloud customers since the launch of the product. As of 2020, he has led the services for the entire suite of products and has a passion for the opportunities and challenges of making all of Relativity’s customers successful across current and new products. Andrew previously held the role of chief information officer at Relativity from 2017-2021, where he built and supported the organization’s information technology along with governance and compliance processes. He joined the company in 2016 as VP of IT to oversee the IT department comprising of three groups: applications, infrastructure, and project management. Andrew has more than 20 years of experience in IT.

Prior to joining Relativity, he served as the director of IT at Morningstar, an investment research and management firm. At Morningstar, he oversaw a 200-person IT department, lead the information technology aspects of 30 acquisitions and two divestures, and implemented both major system enhancements and significant technology and security improvements. Before moving to Chicago, Andrew held several IT positions in Australia, his home country, at companies including WorldxChange, New Tel, and SingTel. Andrew holds a computer science degree from the University of Technology Sydney.

Fun Facts

Started using a computer when he was eight years old and learned how to program because his parents wouldn’t buy more games

Is Australian and he tries to escape Chicago’s winters every January or February

Adam Weiss

Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Legal Officer

Adam joined Relativity as Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Legal Officer in January 2023. In his role, he is charged with assessing and advancing operational and organizational effectiveness across the company. He oversees Relativity's Legal, IT and Poland-based Operations departments. Adam also focuses on fostering connections and collaborating with Relativity customers, partners and stakeholders, drawing upon his own background as a legal executive.

Adam has two decades of experience in the legal and technology industries. He previously held the position of Chief Administrative Officer and General Counsel of Cornerstone OnDemand where in addition to overseeing legal and data privacy functions, his responsibilities included managing human resources, internal communications, IT and business systems with a focus on organizational effectiveness, employee experience and operational efficiency. During his 16-year tenure with Cornerstone, he supported annual revenue growth from $7 million to nearly $900 million and played an integral role in guiding the company through major milestones, including global expansion, an initial public offering, multiple acquisitions, a founder-CEO transition, a $5.2 billion take-private transaction and the creation of the Cornerstone OnDemand Foundation.

Prior to joining Cornerstone, Adam practiced law at what is now Lurie, Zepeda, Schmalz, Hogan & Martin. He holds a J.D. from UCLA School of Law and a B.A. in Economics and Political Science from Stanford University. He has served on the boards of several nonprofit and community organizations, including Shalom Institute, the Santa Monica Chamber of Commerce, IKAR and American Jewish Committee.

Fun Facts

He has been an avid runner for more than 20 years but has never run a marathon.

He spends a portion of most summers in Poland, his wife’s home country.

He has officiated 10 weddings.

Andrew Sieja

Founder and Executive Chairman

Andrew Sieja is the founder and executive chairman of Relativity. As Relativity embarks on a multi-year transformation into a cloud-based SaaS company, Andrew is committed to offering a great product, providing relentless customer support, and ensuring that team members love working at Relativity. Andrew also started Relativity Gives, a community outreach program that has invested nearly $2 million in education and technology causes in Chicago, London, and Kraków. A computer programmer by trade, Andrew loves technology and worked as a technologist for a variety of multi-national companies and consulting firms prior to starting Relativity.

Fun Facts

Loves to snowboard

Once worked in an airport baggage department

Still remembers the smell of the Microsoft QuickBASIC manual — his first foray into computer programming
